result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:30 AM Defendant Maurice Lavelle Hatchett in court by video with attorney Jason D Sanders by video. Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Ross Wenger of Rock County Sheriff's Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects with argument. State moves to orally amend to 1(b). Court does not order amendment at this time and to be heard by Judge. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Bond to continue.  Arraignment scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance

3:38 PM Defendant Maurice Lavelle Hatchett in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Shanna Sanders by video. Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond set of $500.00 with conditions: No contact with co-defendants Anastasia Mack or Shanelle Sanchez. No contact with Home2Suites Hotel. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint. Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Defendant to provide a mailing address within 48 hours of release from custody. Preliminary hearing is requested by zoom and scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 9:15AM.
